verses.verse: Wisdom <WH2454> hath builded <WH1129> her house <WH1004>; She hath hewn out <WH2672> her seven <WH7651> pillars <WH5982>:
She hath killed <WH2873> her beasts <WH2874>; She hath mingled <WH4537> her wine <WH3196>; She hath also furnished <WH6186> her table <WH7979>:
She hath sent forth <WH7971> her maidens <WH5291>; She crieth <WH7121> upon <WH1610> the highest places <WH4791> of the city <WH7176>:
Whoso is simple <WH6612>, let him turn in <WH5493> hither <WH2638>: As for him that is void of understanding <WH3820>, she saith to him <WH559>,
Come <WH3212>, eat <WH3898> ye of my bread <WH3899>, And drink <WH8354> of the wine <WH3196> which I have mingled <WH4537>.
Leave <WH5800> off <WH6612>, ye simple ones <WH2421>, and live; And walk <WH833> in the way <WH1870> of understanding <WH998>.
He that correcteth <WH3256> a scoffer <WH3887> getteth <WH3947> to himself reviling <WH7036>; And he that reproveth <WH3198> a wicked <WH7563> man getteth himself a blot <WH3971>.
Reprove <WH3198> not a scoffer <WH3887>, lest he hate <WH8130> thee <WH3198>: Reprove a wise man <WH2450>, and he will love thee <WH157>.
Give <WH5414> instruction to a wise <WH2450> man <WH2449>, and he will be yet wiser: Teach <WH3045> a righteous <WH6662> man <WH3254>, and he will increase in learning <WH3948>.
The fear <WH3374> of Jehovah <WH3068> is the beginning <WH8462> of wisdom <WH2451>; And the knowledge <WH1847> of the Holy <WH6918> One is understanding <WH998>.
For by me thy days <WH3117> shall be multiplied <WH7235>, And the years <WH8141> of thy life <WH2416> shall be increased <WH3254>.
If thou art wise <WH2449>, thou art wise <WH2449> for thyself <WH3887>; And if thou scoffest, thou alone shalt bear it <WH5375>.
The foolish <WH3687> woman <WH802> is clamorous <WH1993>; She is simple <WH6615>, and <WH1077> knoweth <WH3045> nothing <WH4100>.
And she sitteth <WH3427> at the door <WH6607> of her house <WH1004>, On a seat <WH3678> in the high places <WH4791> of the city <WH7176>,
To call <WH7121> to them that pass <WH5674> by <WH3474>, Who go right on their ways <WH734>:
Whoso is simple <WH6612>, let him turn in <WH5493> hither <WH2638>; And as for him that is void of understanding <WH3820>, she saith to him <WH559>,
Stolen <WH1589> waters <WH4325> are sweet <WH4985>, And bread <WH3899> eaten in secret <WH5643> is pleasant <WH5276>.
But he knoweth <WH3045> not that the dead <WH7496> are there <WH7121>; That her guests are in the depths <WH6012> of Sheol <WH7585>.
